title: Forecast Seasonal Yield Variability for Major Food Grains in India
problem_statement: This task aims to predict seasonal yield variability for major food grains in India using historical yield data across seasons. Yield is a critical indicator of agricultural productivity and is influenced by factors like weather, soil, and farming practices. All columns verified ≥65% data completeness.

join_plan.notes: The dataset contains a composite key of [Crop, Season] which can be used to uniquely identify yield records for each crop-season combination.

transform_ideas: Normalize yield values by crop type
Create lag features for previous seasons
Encode season as a categorical variable
feature_plan.handling_missingness: Impute missing values using forward-fill or mean imputation based on crop type.

validation_plan: Use time-based cross-validation to evaluate model performance, splitting data by year to avoid data leakage. Validate using RMSE and R² metrics.
quality_checks: Ensure all yield values are positive
Check for data consistency across seasons
Validate that imputed values align with historical trends

excluded_columns.reason: Not directly relevant to yield prediction
